definition: To cause pain, suffering, or trouble to someone or something.
examples: Seasonal allergies afflict many people.
The region was afflicted by flooding.

definition: Unable to produce plants or fruit; lacking in interest or results.
examples: Nothing grew on the barren land.
Their search proved barren of clues.

definition: To be made up or composed of something.
examples: The team consists of ten players.
Dinner will consist of soup and bread.

extra.memory_tip: Consist of = the parts that ‘sit together’.

definition: A long period with little or no rain.
examples: The crops failed during the drought.
Water use was limited because of drought.

definition: To wear away gradually by water, wind, or other natural forces; to slowly reduce or damage.
examples: Waves erode the cliffs.
Lies can erode trust.

definition: To become larger or to make something larger; to increase in range or amount.
examples: Heat makes air expand.
The company plans to expand into Asia.

definition: A severe shortage of food that affects a large area or population.
examples: Aid arrived to relieve the famine.
Crops failed and famine followed.

definition: Able to produce many plants or crops; rich in nutrients.
examples: Seeds sprout quickly in fertile soil.
The valley is fertile and green.

extra.memory_tip: Fertile soil is full of life.

definition: A fertile area in a desert where water is found; a pleasant place or moment of relief.
examples: They rested at an oasis after crossing the dunes.
The park is an oasis in the busy city.

extra.memory_tip: Oasis = ‘oh!’—a spot of water and shade.

definition: Grassland where animals graze; to put animals out to feed on grass.
examples: Cows grazed in the pasture. (noun)
They pastured the sheep on the hillside. (verb)

definition: Relating to early stages of development; simple or basic; a person from an early stage of civilisation (dated).
examples: They used primitive tools made of stone. (adjective)
The exhibit shows primitive art. (adjective)

definition: Shelter or protection from danger or trouble; a safe place.
examples: The cave offered refuge from the storm.
They sought refuge in a nearby village.

extra.memory_tip: Refuge = a place where you feel safe.

definition: To return to a former state, condition, or topic.
examples: Without care, the garden will revert to weeds.
Let’s revert to the main question.

extra.memory_tip: Revert = re-turn to the previous version.

definition: To be full of or swarming with something.
examples: The river teems with fish in spring.
On market day the streets teemed with shoppers.

definition: To dry up, shrivel, or fade; to weaken or fall away.
examples: Leaves wither without water.
Confidence can wither after repeated failures.
